CatDescriptText: Frances Dow, salesgirl, Carrick and Frances Carter, secretary, East End were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, October 22, 1960, pg. A1 with question "Do you think Negro voters consider local or national issues in the casting of their votes?" Ms. Dow's answer reads: "I think every individual votes on the local issue. The national issues affect him, but not as much as those local ones, like solutions to problems in the city"  Ms. Carter's answer reads: "The national issues is what voters ballot on, and the reason is because they are concerned with the overall picture of conditions."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Frances Dow wearing textured square patterned button down collared shirt, standing in front of buildings; Portrait of Frances Carter wearing tweed skirt and light colored cardigan, standing in front of store with sign, notebook on left edge of frame
